Text.Value: Back away.
Stay back. I don't want to hurt you, but I will.
Bow deeply - a submissive gesture.
They took the shiny one. He killed many.
Do you know the dead ox outside?
Attack first.
Hm. You're not one of them.
Calm, friend. I won't harm you.
Interpret his behaviour.
*Moo.*
*The creature turns a piece of cud around its mouth, chewing contentedly.*
NO! DIE!
You're one of them! Monster!
Did you kill the goblin in the stable?
Defend yourself.
An attack. Monsters... little ones, and taller ones.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Looks to the dead goblin - camera follows

Text.Value: *You gather nothing from his intense stare.*
*Sniff.*
*His glassy eyes roll, wild with fear, as he begins to charge.*
Walk well, friend.
Hold out your hands peacefully.
BACK DOWN, BEAST.
Back down. Or else.
*He huffs and, after a moment, appears to relax.*
Leave.
*Bellow!*
You speak to me? The monsters only scream.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [animal] Slightly out of breath - calming down
EditorData.NodeContext: Slightly out of breath - calming down

Text.Value: Yes. It was screaming, waving around its metal.
*The ox calms, his tail swishing a satisfied arc.*
Monsters... everywhere... kill...

EditorData.AnimationTags: [animal] Taking deep, scared breaths, speaking on the exhale.
EditorData.NodeContext: Taking deep, scared breaths, speaking on the exhale.

Text.Value: No. You're not one of them at all.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [animal]  Slightly out of breath - calming down
EditorData.NodeContext: Slightly out of breath - calming down

Text.Value: Stare down the beast.
Stare him down, as you have so many beasts in the wild.
*Grunt!*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Front hoof clawing at the ground, ready to charge.

Text.Value: Him? He was the biggest. Now I'm the biggest.
*You manage only to agitate him more.*
Look at me - I'm not a monster.
You'd give me a choice? Hm. You're not like them.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [animal] Slightly out of breath - calming down
EditorData.NodeContext: Slightly out of breath - calming down

Text.Value: *His hide twitches, every muscle primed to bolt. He's terrified.*
Square your stance and face him directly.
I made him stop screaming.
*The ox tenses, horns lowered in your direction.*
LIAR! DIE!
No... you're not. They were small like you, but uglier.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [animal]  Slightly out of breath - calming down
EditorData.NodeContext: Slightly out of breath - calming down

Text.Value: Defend yourself.
It's all right. What happened here?
I was ready to run you through. My mistake, friend.

Synopsis:
An agitated ox, trapped in a stable near a burning inn. The inn was attacked by goblins and drow in the night. Players may try to calm him - if they fail, he attack.
In his SwA version, he speaks like a human. He is initially in a state of terrified rage, barely able to form sentences. If he's pacified, he is calm and placid.
The ox is standing in a stall, a dead goblin at his feet. When players arrive, he is agitated, ready to attack at a moment's notice. If calmed, he will relax and moo peacefully.
